"In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for president in 2012," he said. The Crown Prosecution Service has also asked a senior QC to "comprehensively" re-examine material amassed as part of the original inquiry and any new evidence. In his resignation statement, Mr Andy Coulson said: Nothing is more important than the Government's task of getting this country back on its feet. "Unfortunately continued coverage of events connected to my old job at the News of the World has made it difficult for me to give the 110% needed in this role. "I stand by what I've said about those events but when the spokesman needs a spokesman it's time to move on. Mr Andy Coulson joined Mr David Cameron 's team before the General Election and then ran the PM's communications strategy. American Idol's season-one co-host Brian Dunkleman admits to having been extremely freaked out the first time he saw Simon Cowell tell someone they should never sing again. It's one thing to watch it on television, but then you spend time with these kids and you have to look at them right in the eyes, and then their mother is looking at you, like, "What just happened?'? When specifically asked on Radio 4's Today programme whether Andy Coulson had offered to resign over the continuing News of the World phone-hacking controversy, David Cameron said: I don't have to go into private conversations. He admitted that Andy Coulson was embarrassed by the speculation.
